title: Man excretes polio virus for 30 years, finally caught. – Science Vibe
cleaned_text:
For more than 30 years a man has excreted the polio virus before he was finally caught. A British man has been excreting an active polio virus was reported on August 27th in PLOS Pathogens, he had a weakened immune system that caused a polio vaccination to replicate inside him.

This has been known to happen with other people, but it has never been observed occurring for such a long time. Inside the man’s body, the virus has changed and evolved into new versions from the strain of the vaccine. However, existing vaccines still protect against the altered viruses. But an author of the study, Javier Martin, a virologist at the National Institute for Biological Standards and Control in Potters Bar, England, said it’s important to monitor the virus changes, in case it evolves into something deadly for even vaccinated people.

In countries where people are vaccinated against polio, a polio-excreting man isn’t much of a problem, unless he does it on your couch or car. In developing countries with less polio coverage, people with weakened immune systems who excrete the virus won’t survive long enough for the virus to spread. The British man now takes immune proteins to fight the virus he’s carrying, and he’s at risk of developing polio that could paralyze him.
